comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Maneckji Nusserwanji (MN) Dhalla (1875-1956) was an Indian-born theologian, writer, and Zoroastrian priest; in 1914, he and his wife were in the US, because he was on a lecture tour and publishing his book "Zoroastrian Theology." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maneckji_Nusserwanji_Dhalla Professor A. V. Williams Jackson of Columbia, an expert on Indo-Iranian languages, hosted Dhalla on his 1914 trip to the US. Djelal Munif Bey was the Turkish Consul General in New York. Henry Clews(1836-1923) was an English-born American financier, and father of anthropologist Elsie Clews Parsons (1875-1941).

comment.author: 70304095@N02
comment._content: For A. V. Williams Jackson (1862-1937) there are also entries in the Encyclopaedia Britannica, as well as in the Encylopaedia Iranica. Is there any information about the unidentified man with beard and glasses? Thanks!

comment.author: 70304095@N02
comment._content: Maneckji Nusserwanji Dhalla studied with Jackson at Columbia; for more information on Dhalla, see his entry in the Encyclopaedia Iranica.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Islamic books:  Thank you for the references to the Encylopaedia Iranica articles which are very informative. Unfortunately we don't have information about the unidentified man. Perhaps someone can help us figure it out?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Arden: LOC's title gives the wrong initials for A. V. W. Jackson. And shouldn't Munif Bey be two words?

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Wystan: Yes, Munif Bey is two words and the caption on the negative has the correct  intials for Jackson. We have made the title corrections to the description in our online catalog, and they will be visible in Flickr when we reload the database.
